definition: (of the sunlight) to bathe all things/to shine gloriously
general/popular/everywhere/universal
according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before
(idiom) sunlight shines over all things/drenched in sunlight

sentences.english: I was so relaxed by my day at the beach, that I fell asleep in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 在陽光普照的海灘上，我放鬆得睡着了。

sentences.english: Everythingthe light touches is our kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 陽光普照之處皆是我們的國土。

sentences.english: So she's been eyeing a sun-drenched section of our back fence.
sentences.chinese: 所以，她一直盯著一個陽光普照的一段我們回來圍欄。

sentences.english: Let the sky lanterns shine, to illuminate the future, shine with great splendor, blessing the world.
sentences.chinese: 讓天燈普照大地，照亮未來，光輝燦爛，降福人間。

sentences.english: Buddha illuminates, safe and happy. Paradise on death.
sentences.chinese: 佛光普照，事事順利，吉祥如意，幸福平安。

sentences.english: The dark clouds having dispersed, the sun shone again.
sentences.chinese: 烏雲已散去，太陽又普照大地了。

sentences.english: God, shine your light down here.
sentences.chinese: 上帝，讓你的光芒普照大地。

sentences.english: With the same sunlight on our brow and hair.
sentences.chinese: 那普照的陽光照不到兩人的前額。

sentences.english: High in the sunlit silence. Hov'ring there
sentences.chinese: 在陽光普照的寂靜高天。

sentences.english: Amitabha Buddha emitted uncountable lights from his palm which pervasively illuminated all the Buddhalands.
sentences.chinese: 阿彌陀佛即於掌中放無量光，普照一切諸佛世界。

sentences.english: The light of music illumines the world.
sentences.chinese: 你樂音的光芒普照世界。

sentences.english: Go to the bank of the Yangtse River, it's warm and sunny, trees are thriving and flowers are blossoming.
sentences.chinese: 去長江沿岸，那裏溫暖陽光普照，樹木繁茂花朵盛開。

sentences.english: The whole room was flooded with warm, golden sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 溫暖的金色陽光普照整個房間。

sentences.english: Away over their crests opened out a broad, sunny landscape.
sentences.chinese: 梢望過去，展現着一片寬闊的陽光普照的美景。

sentences.english: I really ought to drag myself outside, but there'd be the sun.
sentences.chinese: 我真想拖着病體到外面去，外面陽光普照。

sentences.english: Our products will be sell at the whole world as the Sun in spring shine all the world.
sentences.chinese: 春天的陽光將普照大地，我們的塑料配件將走向各地。

definition: to shine brightly/(fig.) to perceive clearly
to shine/to illuminate
Buddha's teachings/aura (around the head of Buddha)
(idiom) sunlight shines over all things/drenched in sunlight
to shine brightly/(fig.) to show promise/to be on the up and up
multicolored sunlight of sunrise or sunset
to dazzle/to brighten up (a room etc)
dazzling/brilliant
auspicious light
propitious vapours
to take a bath/to bathe/to immerse
sun
radiance/glory/brilliant/magnificent
Liege, town in Belgium
scorching sun
rising (sun, moon etc)
favor from an emperor or high official
